Title: Head of Data Analytics and Insights
Description:
Join one of Baltimore's Best Places to Work!

About the Company: 

The Baltimore Banner is a nonprofit digital newsroom dedicated to providing high-quality local journalism to the Baltimore metro area. We hope to reimagine the future of local news by building a vibrant, strong, trustworthy, and sustainable news organization. With a multi-platform news operation, we cover a wide range of topics, including local government, culture, and the arts. Our goal is to tell stories that reflect the community, foster connections among neighbors, hold government institutions accountable, and provide a comprehensive understanding of the world. Everything we do is rooted in truth, and we believe that our work can contribute to a more vibrant, informed, and united Baltimore, surrounding counties, and the state of Maryland.

As the Head of the Banner Analytics and Insights team, you will play a central role in driving data-informed decision making across our organization that connects us to our local audience. You will drive and implement our strategy in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various sources to provide valuable insights and recommendations. Your expertise in data analysis, insights, storytelling, and people leadership skills will be crucial in guiding strategic and tactical decisions that influence achievement our goals and fulfillment of our mission.

Head of Analytics Job Responsibilities:

Manage and grow The Banner’s analytics and insights capabilities, including supervision of a direct report, providing guidance, direction, and support in their day-to-day activities. Foster a culture of data-informed decision making within the organization, promoting the use of analytics to drive continuous improvement and innovation. Lead analytics strategy to support the organization's business and newsroom objectives, including cross-functional collaboration, KPI development, and business insights. Enhance and further develop our Data Lake and associated tools, guiding tool selection, ETL processes, documentation, and self-serve data access to key stakeholdersProvide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on data analysis, helping them make informed decisions and drive business growth. Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and advancements in analytics tools and technologies and evaluate their potential to improve our data analysis capabilities. Drive data governance initiatives by establishing data quality standards, ensuring data accuracy, and implementing data security measures. Collaborate with Engineering team to ensure data infrastructure, systems, and tools are optimized to support efficient data collection, storage, and analysis. Effectively communicate complex analytical findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through presentations, reports, and visualizations. 

Required Skills:

Effective leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire a team. Fluency with data warehousing best practices, ETL, and querying large data sets. Our tech stack includes: AWS Lake Formulation, Glue, and S3; Athena; Cloudwatch; Apache AirFlow, MWAA, and Pyspark; Github; Google Cloud Platform; SQL; Python; and PowerBI. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a exceptional attention to detail. In-depth knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and methodologies, data modeling, data manipulation, and data visualization. Proven Business acumen and the ability to connect data insights to business objectives. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, managing multiple priorities and meeting deadlines. 

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or Computer Science. A master’s degree is preferred. Minimum of 7 years of experience in analytics or a related field. Journalism, Digital Media, or E-Commerce experience is a plus. Proven track record of cross-function high visibility delivering impactful insights and recommendations based on data analysis. Excellent understanding of data governance principles and practices. 

The Venetoulis Institute embraces diversity and inclusion, and we are wholeheartedly committed to being proactive in inspiring a culture of inclusion across our organization. We are dedicated to establishing an organization that reflects the fundamental respect for different ways of working and living. We assure every employee the opportunity to reach their full potential.

We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodation due to a disability to participate in the application process, please contact careers@thebaltimorebanner.com to request accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may include, but are not limited to, adjustments in the application process, modifications or assistance regarding job interviews, and accommodations to enable access to our facilities. We appreciate the value that individuals with disabilities bring to our workforce and encourage applicants with disabilities to disclose their needs for accommodation to facilitate a smooth and inclusive recruitment experience.

Title: Business Manager - People Strategy & Analytics
Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, VirginiaBusiness Manager - People Strategy & Analytics

About the organization:

People Strategy & Analytics is an emerging field where Capital One is on the leading front. Our team applies strategic thinking, advanced analytical techniques, and experimental research to uncover new insights and make informed decisions related to our most valuable assets: Capital One associates! The team is comprised of people with diverse skills and backgrounds including: data analysts and engineers, product managers, data scientists, consultants and strategists, business analysts, HR specialists, economists, and Industrial Organizational Psychologists.

As a Business Analysis Manager you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to solve open-ended, complex questions about how we should attract, develop, and retain top talent. You will work closely with HR partners and senior executives to shape talent policy, automate real-time data and improve talent decision-making. Your day-to-day might involve:

 Using data to help executives set ambitious but achievable diversity initiatives  Building models to predict attrition, and testing new retention strategies  Designing new ways to understand and measure associate potential  Developing analyses and tools to help Capital One source and hire the best talent 

…and you will do it all in a collaborative environment that promotes continuous learning, rewards innovation, and prioritizes your development.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

 Strategy consultation: Partner with our clients to identify high impact opportunities to transform the associate experience, conduct analysis, and share insights that inform solutions  Design: Drive and build key programs and analytics solutions for our partners, including measurement strategy, attribution modeling, and automated insights  Experimentation: Partner with clients to design experiments to understand key drivers of associate behavior  Insights & analysis: Analyze the impact of our programs and combine those insights with the latest thinking in organizational science to help our clients make data-driven, informed decisions 

Successful Team Members Demonstrate Competencies In These Areas

 Purpose: You feel a deep personal connection to improving the associate experience and are motivated by applying advanced analytics in a mission-driven way  Analytical thinking: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation. Identify opportunities for improvement and use data to make strategic and tactical recommendations  Execution: Develop and test hypotheses, design solutions, assess operational feasibility, support implementation efforts, and develop plans and tools for monitoring outcomes  Partnership: Collaborate effectively with other team members and clients in HR  Business communication: Strong written and oral communication skills, including visualization skills (i.e., able to “tell the story” and highlight key insights in a clear and concise manner that is easily understood by stakeholders)  Results focus: Drives for results and achieves important goals applying strong organizational skills and detail orientation, even amidst ambiguity 

 Basic  Qualifications: 

 Bachelor’s Degree  At least 2 years of experience in analysis 

 Preferred Qualifications: 

 Master’s Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering  At least 5 years of experience in analysis  At least 2 years of experience in consulting  At least 1 year of experience with SQL and Python

About Dialpad

Work Beautifully

Dialpad is the leading Ai-Powered Customer Intelligence Platform that is transforming how the world works together. Based on 4 billion minutes of analyzed voice and meetings data and growing, we have designed one, beautiful workspace that seamlessly combines the most advanced Ai Contact Center, Ai Sales, Ai Voice, and Ai Meetings with Ai Messaging. More than 30,000 innovative brands and millions of people use Dialpad to unlock productivity, collaboration, and customer satisfaction with real-time Ai insights. With initial funding and leadership from Google and leading venture capitalists such as ICONIQ and Andreessen Horowitz, Dialpad has over $200M in ARR and is one of the fastest growing Ai companies in the world.

About The Team

Dialpad’s Data Analysts bring together product expertise and advanced analytics skills to enable product teams to identify improvement opportunities that translate into new features and experiments. In this role, you’ll combine research, data science, data storytelling and experimental design (i.e A/B Testing) to create product insights that contribute to the product team’s decision making process.

Dialpad’s Product Analytics team plays an essential role in increasing awareness of the product features and user behavior that correlate with product adoption, product stickiness and trial conversions. Title: Consumer Insights Manager
Description:
Overview

AARP is the nation’s largest nonprofit, nonpartisan organization dedicated to empowering people 50 and older to choose how they live as they age. With a nationwide presence, AARP strengthens communities and advocates for what matters most to the more than 100 million Americans 50-plus and their families health security, financial stability and personal fulfillment. AARP also produces the nation’s largest circulation publications AARP The Magazine and AARP Bulletin.

AARP’s Policy, Research and International Affairs leads the development and communication of AARP’s public policies and, research and insights on the issues that matter to people 50-plus.

The Consumer Insights Manager is responsible for conceptualizing, developing, and conducting primary and secondary research to generate valuable insights that shape departmental objectives. They evaluate programs and business priorities to identify areas for improvement and measure outcomes. Working closely with management, they identify opportunities to streamline consumer insights processes and develop new procedures that align with the needs of the business unit/department. Additionally, the Consumer Insights Manager takes the lead and collaborates on developing a research agenda to address critical questions and provide key data that supports the Association's priorities. This role specifically focuses on supporting AARP's Fun & Fulfillment strategy which includes events, entertainment, and social connection.

Responsibilities

Advises clients, stakeholders, and senior management on all phases of research, including conceptualization, recommendations for research methodology, and recommendations for action from research findings. Manages complex and conflicting relationships among multiple stakeholders. Represents Association’s research to external audiences including the media, legislators, and other organizations in venues including press conferences and professional meetings.Manages and collaborates on a major research portfolio with broad Association impact and synthesizes the complex array of data into clear, actionable insights. Develops and manages the overall research plan for the portfolio of work including specific project work plans, project budgets, requests for proposals, vendor selection and management of vendor work. Oversees the work of staff assigned to projects within the portfolio and provides direction, feedback, and contributions to staff performance reviews.Conceptualizes and designs complex research projects, including with high-risk or innovative methodologies and highly constrained timelines and resources. Selects the most appropriate data sources and collection methods to maximize the value and utility of the research across the organization, with the goal of building and aggregating a base of knowledge around key issues. Oversees vendors or supervises other staff who implement the data collection plan.Determines strategies for data analyses. Conducts and/or supervises data analyses including bivariate analysis, multivariate analysis, and other complex statistical techniques as required. Advises other research staff on statistical and data analytic issues.Communicates research findings, often from complex studies or from a program of research, by integrating related research and identifying implications of the research for action by decision-makers. Determines methods to communicate research results and works closely with others to develop clear, impactful deliverables for stakeholders including data visualization and graphics. Responds effectively to complex and challenging requests for clarification and elaboration of research results.Serves as an expert resource and is often responsible for work with high visibility and critical outcomes. Plays a role in managing knowledge resources by actively sharing knowledge, collaborating with others, synthesizing research to provide integration and context, and ensuring the maintenance of up-to-date research records that are accessible by others. Stays abreast of key news, policies, and consumer trends related to assigned core issue areas and research portfolio and applies that knowledge to proactively frame future research.Develops capacity by coaching and mentoring junior staff, participating in efforts to redesign workflow and systems, and providing peer review and technical assistance to other researchers.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Social Science or Marketing. Additionally, a minimum of 5 years of experience in applied research.A solid understanding of social science or marketing theories and principles.Proficiency in conducting both primary and secondary research to gather relevant data and insights.Ability to analyze research findings and develop actionable recommendations that inform policies, programs, strategies, or product development.Excellent consultation and communication skills to effectively convey research findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

Preferred

Master's degree in a social science, Marketing, or a Master's in Business Administration (MBA).Strong background in both quantitative and qualitative research methods and data analysis.Strategic consultation and insight generation skills.

AARP will not sponsor an employment visa for this position at this time.

Additional Requirements

Regular and reliable job attendanceEffective verbal and written communication skillsExhibit respect and understanding of others to maintain professional relationshipsIndependent judgement in evaluation options to make sound decisionsIn office/open office environment with the ability to work effectively surrounded by moderate noise

Flexible Work Arrangement (FWA)

AARP observes Mondays and Fridays as telecommuting workdays, except for essential functions. Remote work and telecommuting can only be done within the United States and its territories.

Compensation And Benefits

AARP offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including a 401(k); 100% company-funded pension plan; health, dental, and vision plans; life insurance; paid time off to include company and individual holidays, vacation, sick, caregiving, and parental leave; performance-based and peer-based recognition and tuition reimbursement. 

Equal Employment Opportunity

AARP is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. AARP does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, color, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, mental or physical disability, genetic information, veteran status, or on any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Sunnyvale, CA

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

LinkedIn’s Data Science team leverages big data to empower business decisions and deliver data-driven insights, metrics, and tools in order to drive member engagement, business growth, and monetization efforts. With over 900 million members around the world, a focus on great user experience, and a mix of B2B and B2C programs, a career at LinkedIn offers countless ways for an ambitious data scientist to have an impact.

You’ll be responsible for building a strong technology-driven culture, overseeing some of the most talented scientists and engineers on the planet, and helping them to pursue their passion and transform their careers. You will develop a strong bench of talent across people and technical leadership, and help the team find their voice to articulate how our Go-To-market teams can be Data First. Your growth will come from building and supporting strong leaders to whom you can effectively delegate, mentor for peak performance, define clear roles and accountability, communicate clear priorities and maximize cross-organizational alignment. Your long-term success will come not from a “command and control” style, but from “inspire and empower.”

At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together.

Responsibilities:

● Lead and manage a team of high-performing data science professionals, and cross-functional teams to design, develop and manage core company executive metrics and methodologies, create insightful automated dashboards and data visualization to track them and extract useful business insights

● Act as a thought partner to senior leaders and executives to develop long-term roadmaps and strategy, prioritize/scope projects, provide recommendations and evangelize data-driven business decisions in support of strategic goals

● You will set a vision and design a long-term Data Science roadmap to prioritize investments with horizontal teams that will elevate business decision making through advanced analytical approaches, algorithms, and tooling. 

● You will set a vision and design a long-term Data Science roadmap to prioritize investments with horizontal teams that will elevate business decision making through advanced analytical approaches, algorithms, and tooling. 

● You will act as a champion for a data-driven culture, evangelizing best practices both with LinkedIn and among the local and global data science community.

● You will provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members and uplevel team’s craftsmanship.

Basic Qualifications:
● BS or above degrees in a quantitative field: Computer Science, Operational Research, Statistics, Economics, or related fields
● 7+ years of relevant industry or relevant academic experience in Data Science 
● 2+ years experience in managing a team
● Experience with SQL or relational database query performance and at least one programming language (e.g., R, Python)

Preferred Qualifications:

● 10+ years of relevant work experience
● 3+ years’ experience in managing Data Science teams
● Strong leadership with track records in building high performing Data Science teams, driving projects, applying strategic thinking, building thought leadership and influencing senior leaders and executives
● Demonstrated ability to work with peers in engineering and product management across teams to set technical and product direction
● Excellent communications skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audiences, including executives
● Experience influencing strategy through data-centric presentations

Suggested Skills:
- Executive presence
- Communication
- Technical Leadership

We strongly believe in the well-being of our employees and their families. That is why we offer generous health and wellness programs and time away for employees of all levels

This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.

Title: Lead Analyst

There’s a reason Fetch is ranked top 10 in Shopping in the App Store. Every day, millions of people earn Fetch Points buying brands they love. We’re a revolutionary shopping platform where brands and consumers come together for a loyalty-driving, points-exploding, money-saving party.

Join a fast-growing, founder-led technology company that’s still only in its early innings. Ranked one of America’s Best Startup Employers by Forbes two years in a row, Fetch is building a people-first culture rooted in trust and accountability. How do we do it? By empowering employees to think big, challenge ideas, and find new ways to bring the fun to Fetch. So what are you waiting for? Apply to join our rocketship today!

Fetch is an equal employment opportunity employer.

The Role!

The Marketing & Innovation Analytics team at Fetch is responsible for enabling data-led understanding of performance drivers, userbase dynamics and consumer insights to unlock growth, efficiencies, and a better user experience.

We are looking for a Lead Analyst to join our growing team. In this newly created role, you will have the opportunity to shape strategy for critical product marketing areas, supporting successful feature launches through rich data narratives. You will be the subject matter expert on experiment design, measurement strategy, analysis and data driven storytelling to guide successful user journey and feature lifecycle. In this role, you will own the development of analytics roadmap and insights generation to influence go-to-market strategy based on clear understanding of users’ interaction with the app. You will work in close collaboration with Marketing, Product, Analytics and Engineering to deliver compelling analysis to support the marketing and product organization to drive user growth, retention and engagement based on data and insights.

Success in this role will require a natural flair for envisioning data needs, passion for unraveling actionable insights combined with strong SQL skills. You are inherently curious about user behaviors and motivators, while being outcomes driven with passion for creative problem solving. You have an agile mindset and thrive in ambiguity. In exchange, you’ll be given the opportunity to work with and learn from some of the most passionate, driven, and creative people assembled under one roof.

What You’ll Do

Be a trusted strategic partner to Marketing and Product in building a foundational understanding of Fetch users, their journeys and behaviors.Influence decision makers in cross-functional teams by forming clear hypotheses, (re)defining key metrics of success and building rich data driven narratives on adoption, engagement, and growth opportunities.Ideate, test, and support roll out of product features, own deep dive analysis of pre, during and post launch impact and provide recommendations to optimize user experience and business results. Drive actionable insights from product usage and other relevant data to measure success of experiments, diagnosis of issues to create a robust understanding of general user behaviorAbility to successfully collaborate with and present relevant insights to business stakeholders, including but not limited to Product, Marketing, Engineering, Sales, GTM Strategy.Develop an understanding of and empathy for marketing team’s data needs and represent the team in development of data and analytics roadmap for innovations.Keep a persistent pulse on the health of the business through KPIs and proactively identify opportunities for investigation of trends and drivers. 

To Be Successful In This Role

Bring 3-5 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, consulting, or similar roles. Demonstrate ability to create and modify SQL/Python queries for custom insights by leveraging large data sets. Knowledge of statistical techniques and experience with causal analytics, experiment design and analysis. Ability to deliver actionable insights through cohort analysis, funnels, user journeys, trend, and diagnostic analysis.Excellent written and verbal communication, and ability to translate data into succinct stories for varied groups of stakeholders.High familiarity with visualization tools like Tableau, Grafana, Looker or similar to create and present compelling views of user behavior. Have an entrepreneurial start up mindset, agile, autonomous, willingness to support others and be endlessly curious. Comfortable leading cross functional discussions in a fast paced, highly iterative and sometimes ambiguous environment. 

Bonus Points For

Adept knowledge of marketing and product principles, user behavior trends in consumer tech, retail/CPG environment.Familiarity with product analytics software like Heap, Amplitude or similar.Familiarity with Big Data frameworks like Snowflake, Spark and AWS services.Love of Dogs! . . . Or just tolerance. We're a very canine-friendly workplace.

Compensation

At Fetch, we offer competitive compensation packages to the exceptional folks we hire. The base salary for this position is $85,000 - $110,000. We also offer all employees equity in Fetch, so that everyone can benefit from Fetch’s growth.

At Fetch, we'll give you the tools to feel healthy, happy and secure through:

The ERGs participate in our Inclusion Council with members of executive leadership.Paid Time Off: On top of our flexible PTO, Fetch observes 9 paid holidays, including Juneteenth and Indigenous People’s Day, as well as our year-end week-long break. Robust Leave Policies: 20 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 14 weeks for secondary caregivers, and a flexible return to work schedule. About the team & opportunity

Ontra is seeking a People Analytics Manager reporting to our Director, People Operations & Total Rewards.

This role is a great individual contributor opportunity for a data-driven professional who is excited to build a People Analytics function from scratch. You will partner with multiple functions across the organization to design and improve data systems, workflows, and processes, all while delivering mission-critical insights and analyses to a variety of business and people team stakeholders.

In the role, you will be asked to support a wide array of deliverables ranging from SQL queries, dashboards, and data visualizations, to complex spreadsheet-based models, and compliance reporting. Systems and Processes: Build deep understanding of Ontra's People team datasets, systems, and workflows; collaborate with others to improve the flow of data in various systems used by a variety of stakeholdersData Visualization and Analysis: Leverage Google Sheets, SQL, and data visualization tools to deliver insights that inform business decision-making at OntraCross-functional initiatives: Collaborate with Data, Finance, and other teams at Ontra to manage and improve data-related work e.g., employee listening, OKRs, headcount managementConsulting: Up-level the people team's data capabilities by training others on best practices and basic data visualization and analysis skills; provide guidance to stakeholders on how to use people data in decision makingModeling: Develop key models such as capacity models and policy impact models that inform critical business decisions Reporting: Support the People Ops and Total Rewards team by responding to requests for people data reporting for various internal and external stakeholders e.g., government entities, investors, etc.


What you’ll bring

Technical skills: A strong grasp of SQL (3+ years of SQL), and a Google Sheets expert (5+ years of Google Sheets with the ability to build complex models and tools)Data visualization: 5+ years experience manipulating datasets and building dashboards (e.g., Looker Studio, Sigma, Looker, Tableau)Attention to detail: High tolerance for detail-oriented work and ability to consistently create high quality deliverablesHR knowledge: A basic understanding of HR teams, programs, metrics, and data

Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more. 

The mission of the Business Operations team is to assess how well Pinterest’s strategy is delivering enterprise performance and influence exec-level decisions to evolve strategy and operations accordingly. As the Director of Business Operations, Core, you will lead a data-driven team that drives critical business insights for our Exec Team while partnering with Product, Engineering, Marketing, Data Science, and others across Pinner Growth and Engagement, Shopping, and Content initiatives to improve how we execute. With a combination of exceptional analytical skills, insatiable curiosity, and strong leadership skills, you’ll help us better understand the Pinner experience and drive changes that shape the future of Pinterest.

What You’ll Do:

Own the rhythm for our “core” suite of investments across Pinner Growth and Engagement, Content, and Shopping. Partner with 2 VPs of Product to develop a deep understanding of how their product strategies contribute to Pinterest’s overall business success. Define KPIs for reporting, develop forward-looking forecasts and scenarios, and assess performance against goals to recommend strategy and operational improvements to drive business results.Be the primary point person with our leadership team on understanding metrics movements and trends in our consumer product, and provide data-driven insights on nascent business questions. Break down and solve ambiguous business problems and recommend solutions that inspire action from executives.Lead and mentor a high performing team of data analysts to become thought partners for cross functional stakeholders.


What We’re Looking For:

10+ years of experience, 2+ years of directly related experience as part of 5+ years of technology, finance, economics, or consulting experience in a fast-paced environment.Ability to operate full stack while also developing others. You can self-sufficiently conduct research, analyze data to ask and answer your own questions, visualize data in high signal-to-noise ways that make insights clear and compelling to executives, and create project structure and execution plans to drive swift action from those insights, while also mentoring growing more junior members of the team to eventually be able to do the same.Structured systems thinker who also loves the details. When engaging with a problem, you balance a focus on quick wins and actionability with ways to help Pinterest efficiently solve that problem at scale through systems and repeatable processes, and are comfortable diving into the operational details with the analytical, data, product, and engineering teams that you will be closely partnered with to make it happen.Strong communication and influence skills. You are comfortable partnering with a diverse set of cross-functional teams and synthesizing complex information for clear decision making and action by executives.

 This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model.

Title: Senior Knowledge Analyst - People and Organization
Description:
What You'll Do

As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) In a Client Focused role inside BCG's People and Organization (POP) Practice Area with a focus on Culture and Change Management, you will work in a growing global team, delivering value to clients via individual expertise and/or institutionalized knowledge assets (products, tools, data, workshops, frameworks, surveys, domain-specific data and related expertise, etc.). You will contribute on cases and proposals by contributing relevant analysis and insights and help case teams create strong impact for the client. While contributing to client cases, workshops and proposals, occasional travel to serve clients onsite during staffing assignments is expected to understand client requirements, and design / develop solutions.

You will support commercialization efforts for the topic/sector working, in conjunction with business leaders, through contributing analysis and insights to proposals, client workshops and marketing materials. Additionally, as a Senior Knowledge Analyst, you will contribute to developing intellectual property & assets for the business and assist in onboarding and training junior colleagues based on your topic/sector expertise.

In the People and Organization Practice Area, we focus on Organization Design & Operating Model, Talent and Skills, and Culture and Change Management. Within Culture and Change, we assist clients to deliver sustainable value creation and build adoption across organizational leaders, employees, and programs by influencing the right behaviors and mindsets for success. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst, you will support across all domains, with a specific focus on purpose-driven culture change and transformation management.

YOU'RE GOOD AT

 Solving client problems through formulating and presenting relevant research and/or analytical approaches in change management, culture, or business transformation Managing and successfully delivering many initiatives with multiple milestones in a client setting Building client-ready deliverables In Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and Word Communicating with senior stakeholders, in a credible and confident way Collecting, synthesizing, and analyzing case team learnings and outputs to develop new proprietary knowledge assets Working collaboratively and effectively in a group dynamic often virtual, proficient in agile ways of working Flexibility and bringing a curious and creative mindset, open to new things and able to propose innovative ideas Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity, independently managing work products to meet agreed upon deadlines and expectations

You Bring (experience & Qualifications)

 1-2+ years of consulting experience in change management, culture transformation, or program management required; candidates with consulting experience strongly preferred In lieu of consulting experience, 2+ years minimum industry experience required; 3-6+ years of industry experience strongly preferred Bachelor's Degree required (advanced degree preferred) Fluency in English Strong business acumen and problem-solving capabilities Strong written and verbal communication skills

YOU'LL WORK WITH

As a Client Focus KT, you will work face to face with clients and with BCG Project Leaders, Associates and Consultants. In the period between cases, you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.

Additional Information

The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members are staffed on cases and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

Total compensation for this role includes base salary, annual discretionary performance bonus, contributions to BCG’s Profit Sharing and Retirement Fund (PSRF), and a market leading benefits package described below.

Some local governments in the United States require job postings to include a reasonable estimate of base compensation. We expect your total annualized compensation to be approximately the following:

 In New York City the base salary is between $114,000 - $121,400 (USD); placement within this range will vary based on experience and skill level In other locations, competitive pay is commensurate with the role and geography Annual discretionary performance bonus between 0-24% 5% Profit Sharing Retirement Fund (PSRF) contribution, increasing to 10% after two years of service. Contributions are vested immediately and there is no waiting period. 

All of our plans provide best in class coverage:

 Zero dollar ($0) health insurance premiums for BCG employees, spouses, and children Low $10 (USD) copays for trips to the doctor, urgent care visits and prescriptions for generic drugs Dental coverage, including up to $5,000 in orthodontia benefits Vision insurance with coverage for both glasses and contact lenses annually Reimbursement for gym memberships and other fitness activities Fully vested Profit Sharing Retirement Fund contributions made annually, whether you contribute or not, plus the option for employees to make personal contributions to a 401(k) plan Paid Parental Leave and other family benefits such as elective egg freezing, surrogacy, and adoption reimbursement Generous paid time off including 12 holidays per year, an annual office closure between Christmas and New Years, and 15 vacation days per year (earned at 1.25 days per month) Paid sick time on an as needed basisEmployees, spouses, and children are covered at no cost. Employees share in the cost of domestic partner coverage.

About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Intelligence Analysis team synthesizes cross-Google intelligence, and prioritizes threats that could harm Google or its users. Analysts deliver actionable assessments to Google stakeholders to drive decision making, risk preparedness, and mitigation.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Senior Product Owner
Description:
What You'll Do

As part of the Global Business Intelligence and Analytics team you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. This Senior Director role plays a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will lead a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future. This role reports into a member of the Enterprise Service Leadership team, specifically the BI&A Product Portfolio Leader.

This BI&A Senior Product Owner role will spearhead initiatives that redefine industry standards, cultivate a culture of continuous improvement and analytical curiosity, and leverage new technologies to solve real-world challenges. You will work as an integral part of an Agile team—working closely with the business, leadership teams, and cross-functional BI&A teams to define and evolve the vision and roadmap for global analytic products used by senior executives across BCG. You will work closely with the technical delivery teams to build solutions that meet the business needs. As well as playing a key role in change management—working with stakeholders on adoption, enablement, and on-going enhancements.

The BI&A Senior Product Owner must be a leader who is customer-centric and enjoys working with teams to design and deliver exceptional products to customers. This is a highly visible role that requires building partnership and trust among senior cross-functional stakeholders. You will also lead a team and work directly with its members to prioritize and manage what needs to be done and by when, empowering the team to deliver. You will coordinate closely with the Product Portfolio Leader to stay aligned on business priorities and make sure the team is progressing and delivering against them.

Among your responsibilities, you will: 

Set the overall product vision and strategy to direct and inform the team’s work 

Define, evolve and drive the roadmap for the global analytics and reporting platform; ensure the products deliver business results and customer value Work closely with the Product Portfolio Leader to understand and drive alignment on business strategy Ensure that products are built in an incremental way, releasing new features that create value for the business Track product performance to inform future work (define measurable KPIs to measure impact) 

Act as the key liaison on cross-functional collaboration 

Partner with leadership from functions outside of BI&A to define and build their analytic roadmap Lead cross-functional collaboration and engagement; identify highest priorities opportunities to support Support activities to define funding and resource requests that enable new analytic product builds Align cross-functional team members on best practices, knowledge sharing; foster community of excellence and innovation 

Serve as the voice of customer 

Engage in continuous discovery, proactively seek feedback from business to understand customer needs Constructively challenge business on assumptions to ensure deeper understanding of requirements, workflows and process to ensure products are fit for purpose Translate the voice and needs of customers into a prioritized list of potential innovations, engaging users as needed Leverage empirical and qualitative data to assess feature performance and inform prioritization Determine tradeoffs involving customer value, cost, and speed to execution Facilitate product demos to empower team members with real-time feedback from customers 

Oversee what is delivered by the Squad and when, ensuring to maximize business value to targeted customers 

Transform objectives into a clear vision for your team to inform the creation and prioritization of the team’s work Prioritize work through a well-organized backlog of user stories and clearly communicate what needs to be done and by when Define and clearly communicate acceptance criteria for output based on business & customer needs 

Ensure the team is supported to get work done

Act as cultural steward, foster innovation and curiosity, ensure voices are heard and team is supported to explore new ideas that can drive value Regularly engage with the Squad to offer feedback on work-in-progress and clarify requirements Engage with Chapter Leads regarding resourcing and functional expertise required in Squad Provide feedback as part of performance management of Squad members and other members of the Product Portfolio 

YOU'RE GOOD AT

Strategic product management 

Defining and articulating analytic product strategy for audiences at all levels Being customer-focused and dedicated to understanding and learning about customer needs and requirements Operating with a transparent mindset, communicating clearly and openly both above and below Being comfortable leading, directing, and empowering team members without formal management authority Driving ang managing change through ambiguous requirements and multi-disciplinary teams Influencing stakeholders up to the senior levels of the organization Bringing a data-driven approach to decision making, both in day-to-day management and in making strategic trade-offs Looking for opportunities to innovate and get things done better and faster 

Business and analytic skills 

Understands the business, decision-making process, workflows, and information needs of business leaders and partners; identifies patterns and can distill insights from information to support decision making Ability to work collaboratively with teams to translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements, identifies ways to visualize and present information to support executive decisions and workflows Looks for opportunities to enhance or expand relationships with business; acts as a go-to-person for end users to interpret and use information Takes initiative and executes independently; effectively prioritizes business problems based on urgency and relevancy Interacts with Information Architects to understand how data is stored, modeled, and tagged—and can help navigate and guide technical design choices 

Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills 

Works positively and collaboratively with others and within team; builds strong and lasting relationships; can partner effectively with team members in multiple time zones Constructively challenges business on assumptions and goals; asks questions that effectively lead to deeper understanding; pushes thinking of business partners and redirects poor business assumptions Develops practical and acceptable compromises when negotiating; adapts style to changing situations and audiences with tact, poise and patience Proactively drives change with strategic persistence Leverages network effectively across functions, offices, regions and/or externally 

You Bring (experience & Qualifications)

Total 12-15+ years’ relevant experience in Business Intelligence roles (e.g. Product Owner, Project Manager) Good understanding of technology enabled business transformation, Product Strategy, Digital Transformation, Organizational Transformation Experience managing people at Sr. Manager or Executive level Understanding of agile principles and ways of working Divergent thinker who can converge ideas into tangible products Exceptional communications and stakeholder management skills Experience in consulting is a plus 

YOU'LL WORK WITH

Every member of your Product Portfolio team for which you will be its servant leader Business Leadership and internal customers, translating their voice and needs into user stories and engaging users as needed Product Portfolio Leaders, who will set the vision, roadmap, budget, and priorities & OKRs for the product team and subsequently, for the squads Scrum Masters, which will act as your right hand to remove impediments and will assess you in dealing with the different artifacts and ceremonies Other Product Owners within BCG, to share best practices and ensure alignment between squads and a culture Agile Coaches, with whom you will share passion about Agile ways of working and with whom you will shape promote business agility (within your teams and in the whole company)

Title: Manager, People Analytics
Description:
Summary

As the People Team at Chobani advances on the journey towards cultivating an analytical and data-driven culture, and we’re seeking a dynamic, independent, and a visionary professional who will be responsible to capture, share and create people insights from a variety of data sources. Working in collaboration with other stakeholders, they will create standard and ad hoc dashboards and stories to enable data focused decision making regarding the Chobani business goals and objectives.

Responsibilities

People Analytics Product Management

 Use HR systems and tools to develop and deliver ad hoc, recurring, and on-demand / self-service reports and data solutions Build and maintain self-service interactive dashboards or presentation-ready materials using Power BI or SaaS-based visualization tools (Eqtble) Mange the end-to-end development process from requirements to completion, and the on-going maintenance and enhancements through release schedules Ensure products are delivered that are audience appropriate, adhering to HR standards for data sharing and meeting the client’s need accurately

Data Governance

 Define and implement key People metrics used within and outside of People Team Develop and implement standards for reporting and analytics including SOPs, data dictionaries Guide the People Systems and Operations team to improve data integrity and quality in the source systems as well as enhancing reporting and analytical capabilities

Data Strategy

 Create long-term strategies to ingest data from various internal HR, Finance & Payroll systems as well as public data from external sources like Compensation benchmarks, DOL, etc. and weave them to provide comprehensive analyses Build and provide requirements for People Data Lake/Warehouse and partner with the IT team during the build, test, and deployment phases

Data Science - Advanced Analytics & Insights

 Conduct investigative research on People Data to tackle business problems Use mathematical and statistical techniques to connect dots across different data points, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns, and then convert them into simple, relatable, and actionable recommendations and interventions that help drive data-driven decisions and strategies Use effective and compelling storytelling methods to convey insights to People and Business Leaders

Leadership Engagement

 Implement a standard approach to reporting People data in partnership with the People Leadership team and other stakeholders Empower business leaders to self-serve data and interpret and apply insights through tools and training Make presentations and present to the People Leadership Team or Executive Leadership Team, periodically or as needed

Mentorship & Training

 Guide peers and stakeholders across the People Team on best practices and usage of People Analytics products Build and maintain training guides and other content for users

Continuous Improvement

 Continually identify and implement new market best practice and overall process improvement opportunities Recommend improvements and influence system owners to incorporate changes to business processes that could ultimately enhance reporting and analytics capabilities

Requirements

 Bachelors Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or relevant fields in HR, I/O Psychology, or comparable work experience 8+ years of experience working with: People/HR data and systems like SAP SuccessFactors, Workday, or Oracle HCM ATS and Payroll systems Native reporting capabilities within HRIS Data extraction and prep tools like SQL, Power Query, Alteryx, Tableau Prep, etc. 5+ years of experience with BI and data visualization tools like PowerBI, Tableau, QlikView, etc. In-depth knowledge of all areas of HR such as Talent Acquisition, Talent and Performance Management, Learning, Compensation & Benefits, etc. 3+ years of hands-on experience with Employee Experience and Survey tools like Qualtrics, Glint, Culture Amp, etc. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyze, significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Excellent storytelling abilities with strong experience in weaving multiple data points into actionable insights Demonstrated ability to communicate and present complex finding to audiences of all levels including C-Suite executives Experience with SaaS People Analytics tools like Eqtble or Visier is a plus Proven track record of delivering value-added insights aligned with business goals Recent demonstrated experience supporting a fast paced and nimble organization This position may be seated in any location with 10-15% travel. If candidate resides in the NY Metro, position will require 20% travel primarily to our Soho location and potentially other locations if needed.

About Us

Chobani is a food maker with a mission of making high-quality and nutritious food accessible to more people, while elevating our communities and making the world a healthier place. In short: making good food for all. In support of this mission, Chobani is a purpose-driven, people-first, food-and-wellness-focused company, and has been since its founding in 2005 by Hamdi Ulukaya, an immigrant to the U.S. The Company manufactures yogurt, oat milk, and creamers – Chobani yogurt is America's No.1 yogurt brand, made with natural ingredients without artificial preservatives. Following the 2023 acquisition of La Colombe, a leading coffee roaster with a shared commitment to quality, craftmanship and impact, the Company began selling cold-pressed espresso and lattes on tap at 32 cafes, as well as Ready to Drink (RTD) coffee beverages at retail.

Chobani uses food as a force for good in the world – putting humanity first in everything it does. The company’s philanthropic efforts prioritize giving back to its communities and beyond: working to eradicate child hunger, supporting immigrants, refugees and underrepresented people, honoring veterans, and protecting the planet. Chobani manufactures its products in New York, Idaho, Michigan and Australia, and its products are available throughout North America and distributed in Australia and other select markets.

For more information, please visit www.chobani.com and www.lacolombe.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn.

Description:
Who We Are

FTI Consulting is the world's leading expert-driven consulting firm. Over the last 40 years, FTI Consulting experts have served as the trusted advisor to Fortune 500 companies and the world's leading law and private equity firms when they are facing their greatest opportunities and challenges. Our strong performance and continued success are a direct reflection of the ambition, energy, and commitment of our talented professionals across the globe to make a positive impact for our clients and communities.

At FTI Consulting, you'll be inspired and empowered to make an impact on headline matters that change history. Working side by side with the world's leading experts in your field, you'll be surrounded by an open collaborative culture that embraces diversity, recognition, professional development and most importantly, you.

There's never been a more exciting time to join FTI Consulting and this is where you will do the most exciting and fulfilling work of your career.

Are you ready to make an impact?

About This Role

In this critical role the MD HR Data & Technology will oversee the portfolio of teams that support the technology and data platform to deliver optimized human capital experiences to FTI Consulting's 8,000 employees and leaders. The role will lead across the areas of HR enterprise software and data insights and analytics. With that the role will sit at the very center of supporting all aspects of HR operations, working across process swim-lanes and the technology stack to create lean, connected, employee-centric experiences for FTIs global workforce. As part of these responsibilities, this role will also lead the due diligence, selection and implementation of a new enterprise grade HCM software solution that transitions the firm away from a highly distributed, best-of-breed solution stack to a more unified platform that can deliver orders of magnitude better experiences and insights to our employees, HR professionals and business leaders.

What You'll Do

Lead HR Information Systems 

 Work with leadership to create a PoV and vision for FTI's next generation software solution(s) including but not limited to Core HRMS, Talent Acquisition, Talent Development, Total Rewards, Payroll and Service Delivery. Drive the execution of that vision through creating compelling business cases that clearly articulate the need and benefits of new technologies.  Create and conduct comprehensive RFIs and RFPs that encompass the needs of the enterprise and evaluate all aspects of potential software vendors including but not limited to functional requirements, technical foundation, implementation methodologies, partnerships, pricing methodology, vendor health and market position, support models including SLAs and KPIs, integrations and extensions, mobile/social capabilities and analytics dashboarding.  Similarly, and in parallel to the software selection, this role will also run a similar process to select an integration partner that fits the style and approach FTI will take in its implementation.  Drive consensus across key stakeholder groups including the steering committee, HR leadership team, and c-suite executives to get a decision on a software solution and integration partner that drive optimal outcomes - including on time and on budget delivery.  Negotiate favorable contract terms and pricing with vendors selected.  Hold software providers and integration partners accountable to agreed upon delivery terms and timelines, escalating and resolving any roadblocks that surface during the project.  Create robust communication and change management plans that drive understanding and adoption of new digital solutions. Employee uptake of the new technology will be a key determinant of success.  Manage the HRIS team to configure, test and deploy new technology solutions in the current stack to key internal customers including the business, HR COEs, and other corporate departments. Aids in managing customer expectations in a way that helps drive planful, proactive, productive conversations that balance business needs with available team capacity and other project priorities. 

Lead HR Data Management, Analytics, Reporting 

 Partner across functions to determine FTI's HR data strategy  Lead the development and execution of strategy for tools, technology, processes, and structure required to provide actionable insights that drive the organization forward.  Provide strategic and consultative support to Global HR in the areas of people metrics, reporting, and advanced predictive analytics capabilities including the use of AI.  Provide strategic guidance on the design and delivery of all HR reporting, dashboards and HR data needed by the organization including requirement gathering, design and testing.  Lead the team on creating and maintaining a blueprint of all HR data models and rubrics that drive sound decision making across the HR function. Design and implement a data governance approach for all HR data.  Oversee the development and management of quarterly talent plans across the business by creating dashboarding and reporting insights that identify potential problem areas that need attention. 

Overall Leadership 

 Demonstrates ability to develop and execute a strategic vision in a global multi-segment, matrixed professional services firm.  Managerial courage to stand up to senior executives and have difficult conversations where needed to drive change and positive outcomes.  Maintains focus and composure through high pressure conditions and able to lead and coach others through challenging situations.  Actively partners with and engages stakeholders across the business incorporating the views of the end-user in building solutions that practitioners will use.  Builds and inspires high performing teams through empowering others and identifying development opportunities for all staff - has high EQ. 

How You'll Grow

We are committed to investing and supporting you in your professional development and we have developed a range of programs focused on fostering leadership, growth and development opportunities. We aim to promote continuous learning and individual skills development through on-the-job learning, self-guided professional development courses and certifications. You'll be assigned a dedicated coach to mentor, guide and support you through regular coaching sessions and serve as an advocate for your professional growth.

As you progress through your career at FTI Consulting, we offer tailored programs for critical professional milestones to ensure you are prepared and empowered to take on your next role.

Basic Qualifications

What You Will Need To Succeed 

 Bachelor's degree in a quantitative or technical field relating to HRIS.  10 years of experience in a leadership role and experience leading multiple teams/engagements around large HRIS/IT projects. 

Preferred Qualifications

 Has experience leading multiple project teams or internal departments simultaneously  Led at least two global, full HCM suite engagements for companies of 5,000 or more employees and served as the person ultimately accountable for successful delivery.  Experience implementing predominant HCM Cloud software packages including Workday, SAP/SuccessFactors and Oracle HCM Cloud.  Experience with and understanding of the current HCM software landscape and how modules interplay with each other including but not limited to (Core HCM, Payroll, Talent Acquisition, Workforce Planning, Onboarding, Compensation, Performance & Succession Mgmt., Learning and Analytics).  Experience negotiating contracts for $5M-$10M projects with both HCM software companies and integration partners to obtain significant discounts and favorable terms.  Has relationships with key software vendors and integration partners along with a set of contacts that can help ensure FTI gets top-grade talent aligned to its implementation.  Excellent consultative skills, with the ability to understand business needs and translate those needs to strategies and actionable plans; able to ask tough questions to discern and synthesize issues and develop thoughtful solutions.  Ability to embrace and influence change at all levels in the organization through careful listening and incorporating different views as a way obtain buy-in.  Experience with both Corporate HRIS leadership roles and full-suite HCM Engagement Leader experience at an integration partner of the aforementioned software suites.  Has led the visioning and implementation of data warehousing and visualization technologies (including MS PowerBI) and created data models/catalogues that outline the full set of all HCM data including attributes, purpose/usage, location etc. Has created data governance models and led data governance committees that evaluate/approve changes to the model. 

Our Benefits

Our goal is to support the well-being of you and your families-physically, emotionally, and financially. We offer comprehensive benefits such as the following:

 Competitive total compensation, including bonus earning potential  Full package of benefits plans, including medical, dental, and vision coverage along with life and disability insurance  Generous paid time off  Company matched 401(k) retirement savings plan  Potential for flexible work arrangements  Generous paid parental leave and flex return support  Family care benefits, including back-up child/elder care  Employee wellness platform  Employee recognition programs  Paid time off for volunteering in your community  Corporate matching for charitable donations most important to you  Make an impact in our communities through company sponsored pro bono work  Professional development and certification programs  Free in-office snacks and drinks  Free smartphone and cellular plan (if applicable)  FTI Perks & Discounts at retailers and businesses  Upscale offices close to public transportation

FTI Consulting is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping clients with their most significant opportunities and challenges. With more than 8,000 employees located in 31 countries, our broad and diverse bench of award-winning experts advise their clients when they are facing their most significant opportunities and challenges. At FTI Consulting, we embrace, cultivate and maintain a culture of diversity, inclusion & belonging, which are fundamental components to our core values. FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been named the #1 Professional Services Firm on Forbes List of America's Best Employers and the best firm to work for by Consulting Magazine. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Instagram and LinkedIn .

About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Modern Creators and Formats (MCF) mission is to empower users to connect and contribute directly to Search. If Search is going to continue to meet the diverse needs of our users, we need to ensure that the web continues to grow with the right content.

Trust and Safety (T&S) is a team of user trust experts who think big and aim high to earn every user’s trust. We cultivate thought leadership, domain expertise, innovation and a cross-product perspective to help Google stay ahead of abuse and deliver trusted and safe experiences to all users.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $108,000-$158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities

Lead and manage multi- quarter, high-visibility trust projects (e.g., build critical trust protections to fight abuse in user generated content space, scale user base to key markets while meeting goal trust metrics). Analyze and debug escalations and identify trends that can indicate bigger product risks.Use technical acumen to drive project delivery, challenge proposals and identify risks. Manage multiple projects of moderate to high complexity and scope against crashed timelines. Collaborate with other teams and functions (e.g., Engineer, Program Manager, Legal, Policy).Drive usage and adoption of AI efforts for effective abuse fighting by identifying opportunities to reduce Operational Expenditure (OPEX), catch abuse faster or improve quality of decision making.Perform on-call responsibilities on a rotating basis, including weekend coverage as needed.

Title: Senior Data Analytics Manager
Description:
The Finance Operations (FinOps) organization has a mission to design and optimize trusted global accounting and disbursement solutions that enable our stakeholders to do more. We develop operations and customer-changing innovations that affect thousands of people around the world. We create space for employees through process & technology, use automation to add value to our stakeholders, and expand our impact through understanding our customer. If you are excited about operational excellence and motivated by innovations that change how Finance operates and thousands of people work, we welcome you to discover more about Microsoft Finance Operations and the value we provide across Microsoft and to our customers and partners.

The Data & Technology Solutions team, as part of FinOps, is a high-performing Data & Technical team that thrives on a growth mindset culture, is passionate about technology and is focused on supporting and accelerating FinOps digital transformation journey and data culture. We equip FinOps teams with precise and consistent knowledge of the organizational data and provide insights that lead to action, enabling teams to create value for the organization by automating and digitalizing financial processes and operations. This allows FinOps to operate more efficiently and effectively, manage risks and compliance and provide the best experience for our customers while reducing our operational costs by scale.

Are you looking for your next career challenge? Join us and help us achieve our mission! We are looking for a Senior Data Analytics Manager who has deep comfort and capabilities in leveraging Microsoft technology to deliver impactful data insights and solutions. The Senior Data Analytics Manager should be a technically savvy and operationally disciplined professional with a proven record of successfully delivering technology-data related solutions and business insights, including business process transformation/automation, advanced analytical data models, data visualization and reporting.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Responsibilities

Business Analytics: 

Be an agent of change by testing the status quo and providing insights to build compelling and actionable business cases that mobilize change. Understand analytical goals and strategic priorities from the FinOps team. Analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques. Gather, synthetize, and analyze qualitative and quantitative data to identify patterns and trends, leading to meaningful insights and actions that can help the organization’s decisions and directions and influence change with stakeholders. Create and visualize dashboards leveraging Microsoft Power BI. 

Data Analytics

Apply expertise in data sources and quality to identify and leverage data across multiple sources, understand data requirements, and evaluate the sufficiency of data for addressing relevant and impactful business questions and challenges. Manage organization data architecture for data collection from a variety of sources, analysis, and to support data science, process automation and experimentation projects. Responsible for how data is stored, consumed, and integrated. Develop analytical data sets in Azure which can be used for analytics, automation solutions, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data science.   Apply technology to represent the best solution for FinOps team’s stakeholders needs. Lead the implementation of a defined technical solution. Build, support, and/or consult others on the execution of formal experiments or prototypes/proofs of concepts, to evaluate the impact of new or changed features or processes. Be a citizen developer leveraging Microsoft Power Platform technology stack to develop low code / no code solutions. Ensure projects and applications consistently meet data integrity and quality standards and policies (security, privacy, etc.) Maintain expertise in data privacy requirements, responsible and ethical data handling practices, and models compliance with classification and governance rules and regulations. 

Leadership

Effective collaboration and engagement with stakeholders to align and prioritize business problems where technology-based solutions can have an impact. Apply a customer - and/or stakeholder - oriented focus by understanding their needs and perspectives. Validate and advise customer and/or stakeholder requirements. Manage and work with various engineering teams to ensure successful solution delivery. Represent our capabilities and service offerings to internal and external audiences. Articulate vision, requirements & benefits, providing a solid rationale to business and technical partners. Influence diverse audiences and build partnerships with stakeholders. Build relationships and trust with stakeholders to drive change. 

Other

Embody our Culture and Values

Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 4+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysisOR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 2+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysisOR equivalent experience.
Additional Or Preferred Qualification

Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 6+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysisOR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 4+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysisOR equivalent experience.Demonstrated analytical ability, complex problem deconstruction into easy-to-understand concepts, statistical competency, data validation and fluency in visualization techniques. Understanding and expertise on cloud-based data pipelines and “data landscape”. Expertise in building data sets in Azure, AWS, Hadoop or similar big data environments and database technology. Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics including Azure Synapse, visualization tools such as PowerBI. Experienced Citizen Developer. Knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform technology (i.e., Power Apps, Power Automate). Advanced SQL skills and proficiency in advanced Excel functions (e.g., creating formulas, pivot tables, VBA). Understanding of Finance processes and needs. Experience in Financial operations is a plus. Unique mix of technical, analytical, development, project management, and process re-engineering skills and expertise. Demonstrated excellence in thought leadership, innovation, process automation and execution management. Ability to identify and implement industry best practices to improve existing processes; demonstrable achievement within a results-driven, highly ambiguous, and dynamic environment.

There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $130,000 - $213,200 per year.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay
